verses.roman:
tā-sabhāra antare bhaya prabhu mane jāni
kahite lāgilā loke śīghra ḍāki' āni'

synonyms: tā-sabhāra—of all of them; antare—in the mind; bhaya—fear; prabhu—the Lord; mane—in the mind; jāni—understanding; kahite—to speak; lāgilā—began; loke—to the people; śīghra—very soon; ḍāki'-calling; āni'-bringing them.
translation: Understanding the anxiety within the people's minds, the Lord called them together and spoke to them as follows.
